channel.title: Preventing razor burn?
channel.description: Anyone know how to prevent razor burn? I dread shaving, because I always seem to get razor burn on my chin.

item.title: Preventing razor burn?
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“pl0x15, post:34, topic:338308”][quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=434697.msg3192094#msg3192094 date=1272371873]
Anyone know how to prevent razor burn? I dread shaving, because I always seem to get razor burn on my chin.
[/quote]

You still get cut, just its on your face so you don’t see it and there is so much water going down that you can’t see the blood. Rofl…
Umm shave when you’re in the shower. That also helps because you can shave you’re NutSack without the Wife walkin’ in. LOL jk. But Shaving in the shower prevents burns/cuts.[/quote]

item.title: Preventing razor burn?

item.description:
@pl0x15 wrote:

The Reaper X:

Anyone know how to prevent razor burn? I dread shaving, because I always seem to get razor burn on my chin.

Umm shave when you’re in the shower. That also helps because you can shave you’re NutSack without the Wife walkin’ in. LOL jk. But Shaving in the shower prevents burns/cuts.

item.title: Preventing razor burn?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

I hardly shave with a razor because it cuts too close for my liking, but what seems to help is using shaving cream with warm water, and a special after shave lotion. (One of my favorites)
